stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the first half of the stream fixing a persistent crash in the overworld (caused by a bad coin-formation object), finishes some basic UV-mapping on wall assets, and then pivots to blue-sky design for the "8-bit pipe" retro section of Course 13: a black-and-white, forced-perspective shooter based on Super Mario Land 1’s airplane stage (4-3). The session closes with him roughing out a 420-triangle 3D plane model and talking through camera, fog, and sprite concerns.

development_findings.summary: Overworld crash traced to a single coin-formation object (coords –5008, –6651, etc.); deleting it stops the emulator from crashing.
development_findings.quote: This was the cause for the crash.

development_findings.summary: Global draw-layer swap (layers 5 ↔ 6) requires renaming across every level to match engine enums; Kaze begins batch changes and vents about the mismatch.
development_findings.quote: I've permanently swapped the draw layers… Why aren't they named right?

development_findings.summary: Basic UV-mapping pass for new wall textures (Brick Serena) completed off-stream; today’s goal was to make them "half decent" before moving on.
Retro section concept locked: Super Mario Land 1, airplane level 4-3, black-and-white palette, 60 FPS, forced-perspective rail shooter with fixed camera.
development_findings.quote: Yes, it being Land 1 is non-negotiable.

development_findings.summary: Technical design for shooter: player moves in screen space while camera stays put; corridor walls will visually limit play area since true solid-white backgrounds aren’t engine-supported.
development_findings.quote: Area background is not supported in this engine… it’s simpler to just do this.

development_findings.summary: Initial 3D plane model finished (about 420 triangles); front faces deleted because they will never be seen, saving budget.
development_findings.quote: I think this is a decent 3D model for this, we can delete the entire front part because it's gonna be invisible in gameplay.

development_findings.summary: Decides Project64 + GlideN64 is the only supported emulator; refuses to spend time on Parallel because every emulator needs unique work-arounds.
development_findings.quote: For me, I just have to pick one emulator and run with it.

development_findings.summary: Uses N64 Expansion Pak, making memory "a little easier" for the hack.
development_findings.quote: Yeah, the expansion pack is used here. It makes everything a little easier.

development_findings.summary: Jokes but conceptually floats adding a Yoshi-themed Chrome Dinosaur mini-game for crash screens.
development_findings.quote: The Chrome Dinosaur game was actually planned for the crash game, but it will be with Yoshi.

context_findings.summary: Parents are visiting Germany for 10 days; father roped him into three hours of garden work before stream.
context_findings.quote: My dad decided that we're setting up the automatic lawnmower today, and I've been working in the garden for like three hours.

context_findings.summary: Massive Yoshi plush collection shown on camera; personal attachment to Yoshi theme.
context_findings.quote: They brought like 15 Yoshis. I have so many Yoshi plushies now.

context_findings.summary: Financial motivation: intends to stream nearly every day to earn more after recent parental-leave period.
context_findings.quote: I need to work more because I want to make more money. So that's why I'm gonna just stream like basically every day now.

context_findings.summary: Expresses nostalgia for Super Mario Land 1; that personal link drives the retro-level choice.
context_findings.quote: I haven't played Land 2 as a child. So for me, Land 1 is the only one that I will have some nostalgia for.

context_findings.summary: Displays frustration with long exporter waits and naming mismatches, punctuated by threats to "scream" at chat tools.

biobak.summary: Active in chat, gives texture/exporter advice and approves Land 1 choice; Kaze repeatedly pings him for feedback.

key_stories.title: Overworld Crash Hunt
key_stories.summary: A mysterious hard crash plagued the overworld build. Kaze suspected collision triangles, then dug through object lists with Nemu and Project64 until he isolated a faulty coin-formation. Deleting the single object restored stability.
key_stories.challenge: Game crashed immediately after load; unclear cause.
key_stories.process: Removed collision triangles, then systematically deleted suspect objects, checking coordinates against logs.
key_stories.outcome: Faulty coin formation removed; overworld boots without crash.
key_stories.key_quote: Aha! This was the cause for the crash.

key_stories.title: Locking the Retro Plane Level
key_stories.summary: Course 13 needed an 8-bit segment. After debating submarines, deserts, and space, Kaze committed to Super Mario Land 1’s airplane stage. He designed a 60 FPS rail-shooter concept, discussed engine limits, and built the first plane model live.
key_stories.challenge: Find a fresh, pre-1996 retro idea that isn’t "just the same game but worse."
key_stories.process: Scrolled through SML1 footage, weighed gameplay translation issues, considered sprite workload, chose forced-perspective shooter, roughed out camera, fog, and model budget.
key_stories.outcome: Concept locked; prototype plane model created; to-do list for enemy sprites and play-area limits.
key_stories.key_quote: Yes, it being Land 1 is non-negotiable.

open_questions.context: He globally swapped layers 5 and 6 but seemed uncertain about enum mapping and asset renaming.
questions: Why was the layer swap necessary in the first place?
How big a task is retrofitting every existing level?
Who else is helping with this refactor and how are tasks divided?

open_questions.context: Conceptualized a 60 FPS forced-perspective shooter but hasn’t detailed implementation.
questions: What engine changes are required for fixed-camera rail movement?
How will enemy AI and hit detection be handled in 2D screen space?
Will this push memory or performance limits on real N64 hardware?

open_questions.context: Kaze worries about creating front-view sprites for SML1 enemies.
questions: Will Zeina or another artist handle the new sprite sheets?
Could voxel models replace sprites entirely?
What tools and workflow will be used to stay within cartridge limits?

open_questions.context: He chose to target only Project64 but this limits player base.
questions: Has the team discussed releasing a hardware-tested build or EverDrive version?
Is there a long-term plan to improve Parallel or other emulator compatibility?
How will they communicate emulator requirements to players at launch?

open_questions.context: Mentions a Yoshi-flavored Chrome Dinosaur mini-game but no details.
questions: Is the crash micro-game still planned?
